intro: Hoya rhodostele, commonly known as the red-stemmed wax plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces fragrant, white to pale pink blooms that appear in late spring or early summer. Its stems are typically reddish or purple in color, which gives it its common name. Hoya rhodostele is a popular houseplant due to its ease of care and ornamental value.
